intro: Thlaspi pinnatifidum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed pennycress, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of pinnately divided leaves, which give it its scientific name. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, typical of the mustard family. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows. Thlaspi pinnatifidum is a short-lived perennial that plays a role in ecological succession and soil stabilization.
